label: DHDDS-related syndrome
definition: Any neurological disorder in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the DHDDS gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, TYR-related, Japanese ratsnake
definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in Japanese ratsnake due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, TYR-related, American mink
definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in American mink due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, TYR-related, Japanese raccoon dog
definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in Japanese raccoon dog due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, TYR-related, Japanese medaka
definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in Japanese medaka due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, TYR-related, water buffalo
definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in water buffalo due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, TYR-related, tufted capuchin
definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in tufted capuchin due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, TYR-related, dog
definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, TYR-related, red fox
definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in red fox due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in domestic ferrets due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in humpback whales due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, TYR-related, rabbit
definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in rabbits due to a mutation in the TYR gene.

label: autosomal recessive cystinuria, SLC3A1-related, dog
definition: Any autosomal recessive cystinuria that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the SLC3A1 gene.

label: cystinuria, SLC3A1-related, domestic cat
definition: Any cystinuria that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the SLC3A1 gene.

label: sex-linked dwarfism, GHR-related, chicken
definition: Any sex-linked dwarfism that occurs in chickens due to a mutation in the GHR gene.

label: GM2 gangliosidosis, dog
definition: A lysosomal storage disease that occurs in dogs in which there is a buildup of GM2 gangliosides in tissues due to the lack of the enzyme hexosaminidase. It is characterised by progressive neuromuscular dysfunction and impaired growth from an early age.

label: GM2 gangliosidosis, domestic cat
definition: A lysosomal storage disease that occurs in cats in which there is a buildup of GM2 gangliosides in tissues due to the lack of the enzyme hexosaminidase. It is characterised by progressive neuromuscular dysfunction and impaired growth from an early age.

label: GM2 gangliosidosis, pig
definition: A lysosomal storage disease that occurs in pigs in which there is a buildup of GM2 gangliosides in tissues due to the lack of the enzyme hexosaminidase. It is characterised by progressive neuromuscular dysfunction and impaired growth from an early age.

label: congenital myasthenic syndrome, CHRNE-related, dog
definition: Inherited disorder of neuromuscular transmission resulting in muscle weakness and fatigability exacerbated by exercise that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the CHRNE gene.

label: congenital myasthenic syndrome, CHRNE-related, cattle
definition: Inherited disorder of neuromuscular transmission resulting in progressive muscle weakness and mortality that occurs in young calves due to a mutation in the CHRNE gene.

label: dwarfism, ACAN-related, horse
definition: Any dwarfism that occurs in horses due to a mutation in the ACAN gene.

label: dwarfism, ACAN-related, cattle
definition: Any dwarfism that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the ACAN gene.

label: osteochondrodysplasia, SLC13A1-related, dog
definition: Hereditary osteochondrodysplasia that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the SLC13A1 gene.

label: chondrodysplasia, SLC13A1-related, sheep
definition: Hereditary chondrodysplasia that occurs in sheep due to a mutation in the SLC13A1 gene.

label: congenital muscular dystonia SLC6A5-related, cattle
definition: Lateral recumbency, low head carriage and transient muscle spasms following tactile or auditory stimulation that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the SLC6A5 gene.

label: cone-rod dystrophy, NPHP4-related, dog
definition: Any cone-rod dystrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in NPHP4 gene.

label: GM2 gangliosidosis, HEXA-related, American flamingo
definition: A lysosomal storage disease that occurs in American flamingo due to a mutation in the HEXA gene.

label: GM2 gangliosidosis, HEXA-related, dog
definition: A lysosomal storage disease that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the HEXA gene.

label: GM2 gangliosidosis, HEXA-related, pig
definition: A lysosomal storage disease that occurs in pigs due to a mutation in the HEXA gene.

label: GM2 gangliosidosis, Muntjak deer
definition: A lysosomal storage disease that occurs in Muntjak deer in which there is a buildup of GM2 gangliosides in tissues due to the lack of the enzyme β-hexosaminidase A. It is characterised by depression, ataxia, circling and visual deficits from an early age.

label: GM2 gangliosidosis, HEXA-related, sheep
definition: A lysosomal storage disease that occurs in sheep due to a mutation in the HEXA gene.

label: GM2 gangliosidosis, rabbit
definition: A lysosomal storage disease that occurs in rabbits in which there is a buildup of GM2 gangliosides in the brain due to the lack of the enzyme β-hexosaminidase A. It is characterised by rapidly progression of neurological signs.

label: dwarfism, PRKG2-related, dog
definition: Any dwarfism that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the PRKG2 gene.

label: dwarfism, PRKG2-related, cattle
definition: Any dwarfism that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the PRKG2 gene.

label: geleophysic dysplasia, ADMATSL2-related, dog
definition: A hereditary connective tissue disorder characterized by extensive fibrosis of the skin and joints that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the ADAMTSL2 gene.

label: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome with absence of dermatan sulfate proteoglycan, cattle
definition: Any Ehlers-Danlos syndrome that occurs in cattle with absence of dermatan sulfate proteoglycan.

label: hereditary chondrodysplasia, dog
definition: Any hereditary chondrodysplaisa that occurs in dogs characterized by short limbs and radius curvus deformity.

label: Chiari-like malformation, dog
definition: Any Chiari malformation that occurs in dogs.

label: primary open angle glaucoma, ADAMTS10-related, dog
definition: Any primary open angle glaucoma that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the ADAMTS10 gene.

label: autosomal dominant cystinuria, SLC3A1-related, dog
definition: Any autosomal dominant cystinuria that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the SLC3A1 gene.

label: autosomal dominant cystinuria, SLC7A9-related, dog
definition: Any autosomal dominant cystinuria that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the SLC7A9 gene.

label: sex-limited cystinuria, dog
definition: Any androgen-dependent cystinuria that occurs in intact male dogs.

label: cleft palate, DLX6-related, dog
definition: Cleft palate that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the DLX6 gene.

label: congenital liver fibrosis, PKHD1-related, horse
definition: A developmental disorder of the biliary system caused by a congenital defect in the remodeling of the ductal plate at the level of the interlobular ducts, resulting in persistence of excessive abnormal embryonic bile duct structures, irregular portal veins, and progressive fibrosis of the portal tracts that occurs in horses due to a mutation in the PKHD1 gene.

label: cholesterol deficiency, APOB-related, cattle
definition: Low plasma cholesterol concentration that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the APOB gene mutation. The “cholesterol deficiency” is a consequence of a decreased ability to be incorporated into lipoproteins for transport in circulation.

label: primary open angle glaucoma, ADAMTS17-related, dog
definition: Any primary open angle glaucoma that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the ADAMTS17 gene.

label: dwarfism, GON4L-related, cattle
definition: Any dwarfism that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the GON4L gene.

label: cystinuria, SLC7A9-related, domestic cat
definition: Any cystinuria that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the SLC7A9 gene.

label: dwarfism, B4GALT7-related, horse
definition: Any dwarfism that occurs in horses due to a mutation in the B4GALT7 gene.

label: epidermolysis bullosa simplex, PLEC-related, dog
definition: Any epidermolysis bullosa simplex that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the PLEC gene.

label: epidermolysis bullosa simplex, KRT5-related, dog
definition: Any epidermolysis bullosa simplex that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the KRT5 gene.

label: epidermolysis bullosa simplex, KRT5-related, cattle
definition: Any epidermolysis bullosa simplex that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the KRT5 gene.

label: paroxysmal dyskinesia, PIGN-related, dog
definition: Any paroxysmal dyskinesia that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the PIGN gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, HPS5-related, three-spined stickleback
definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in three-spined stickleback due to a mutation in the HPS5 gene.

label: oculocutaneous albinism, HPS5-related, domestic cat
definition: Oculocutaneous albinism that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the HPS5 gene.

label: primary ciliary dyskinesia, NME5-related, dog
definition: Primary ciliary dyskinesia that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the NME5 gene.

label: congenital eye malformation, SIX6-related, dog
definition: Any inherited eye defect that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the SIX6 gene.

label: craniomandibular osteopathy, SLC37A2-related, dog
definition: Any craniomandibular osteopathy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the SLC37A2 gene.

label: epidermolysis bullosa simplex, KRT14-related, domestic cat
definition: Any epidermolysis bullosa simplex that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the KRT14 gene.

label: cerebral dysgenesis, PEA15 related, domestic cat
definition: Abnormal development of the telencephalon characterized by microcephaly and polymicrogyria that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the PEA15 gene.

label: dilated cardiomyopathy, DMD-related, rabbit
definition: X-linked dilated cardiomyopathy that occurs in rabbits due to a mutation in the DMD gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: pituitary dwarfism, LHX3-related, dog
definition: Any pituitary dwarfism that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the LHX3 gene.

label: pituitary dwarfism, POU1F1-related, dog
definition: Any pituitary dwarfism that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the POU1F1 gene.

label: paroxysmal dyskinesia, SOD1-related, dog
definition: Any paroxysmal dyskinesia that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the SOD1 gene.

label: epilepsy, mitochondrial dysfunction and neurodegeneration, PITRM1-related, dog
definition: A neurodegenerative brain disorder with mitochondrial dysfunction, amyloid-β accumulation, and lethal epilepsy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the PITRM1 gene.

label: encephalopathy, ASPA-related, domestic cat
definition: A spongy encephalopathy that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the ASPA gene.

label: deafness, KLF7-related, dog
definition: Any hearing loss that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the KLF7 gene.

label: deafness, LOXHD1-related, dog
definition: Any hearing loss that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the LOXHD1 gene.

label: primary ciliary dyskinesia, CCDC65-related, sheep
definition: Primary ciliary dyskinesia that occurs in sheep due to a mutation in the CCDC65 gene. Homozygous affected lambs suffer from respiratory defects predisposing infectious pneumonia with a fatal ending at a young age.

label: deafness, OSBPL2-related, pig
definition: Any hearing loss and hypercholesterolaemia that occurs in pigs due to a mutation in the OSBPL2 gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: dilated cardiomyopathy, RBM20-related, dog
definition: Any dilated cardiomyopathy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the RBM20 gene.

label: Charcot Marie Tooth disease, FGD4-related, cattle
definition: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the FGD4 gene.

label: congenital disorder of glycosylation, GALNT2-related, cattle
definition: Any congenital disorder of glycosylation that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the GALNT2 gene.

label: cleft lip, GADD45G-related, rabbit
definition: Cleft lip that occurs in rabbits due to a mutation in the GADD45G gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: deafness, OTOF-related, sheep
definition: Any hearing loss that occurs in sheep due to a mutation in the OTOF gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: deafness, GJB2-related, pig
definition: Any hearing loss that occurs in pigs due to a mutation in the GJB2 gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: fragile X syndrome, FMR1-related, white-tufted-ear marmoset
definition: Any hereditary neurological disease that occurs in white-tufted-ear marmoset due to a mutation in the FMR1 gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: congenital muscular dystrophy, LAMA2-related, dog
definition: Any muscular dystrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the LAMA2 gene.

label: cryopyrin-associated periodic syndrome, NLRP3-related, pig
definition: Spontaneous systemic inflammation signs and increased delayed hypersensitivity response that occurs in pigs due to a mutation in the NLRP3 gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: dental-skeletal-retinal anomaly, MIA3-related, dog
definition: Brittle, discolored, translucent teeth, disproportionate growth and progressive retinal degeneration resulting in vision loss that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the MIA3 gene.

label: encephalopathy, STXBP1-related, crab-eating macaque
definition: Focal epilepsy that occurs in crab-eating macaque due to a mutation in the STXBP1 gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: chondrodysplasia, EVC2-related, cattle
definition: Hereditary chondrodysplasia that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the EVC2 gene.

label: chondrodysplasia, UGDH-related, domestic cat
definition: Hereditary chondrodysplasia that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the UGDH gene.

label: cleft primary palate, ESRP2-related, chicken
definition: Cleft palate that occurs in chickens due to a mutation in the ESRP2 gene.

label: deafness, EPS8L2-related, dog
definition: Any hearing loss that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the EPS8L2 gene.

label: deafness, CDH23-related, dog
definition: Any hearing loss that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the CDH23 gene.

label: cleft palate, MYH3-related, cattle
definition: Cleft palate that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the MYH3 gene.

label: dwarfism, ANKRD28-related, cattle
definition: Any dwarfism that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the ANKRD28 gene.

label: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease, non-human animal
definition: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: congenital disorder of glycosylation, non-human animal
definition: Congenital disorder of glycosylation that occurs in non-human animals.

label: liver disorder, non-human animal
definition: Liver disorder that occurs in non-human animals.

label: cystinuria, non-human animal
definition: Cystinuria that occurs in non-human animals.

label: hearing loss disorder, non-human animal
definition: Hearing loss disorder that occurs in non-human animals

label: inherited auditory system disease, non-human animal
definition: Inherited auditory system disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: dwarfism, non-human animal
definition: Disturbances in growth processes leading to reduced height in non-human animals.

label: hereditary neurological disease, non-human animal
definition: Hereditary neurological disease that occurs in non-human animals.

label: skeletal dysplasia, non-human animal
definition: Skeletal dysplasia that occurs in non-human animals.

label: 22q-related schwannomatosis
definition: A schwannomatosis that causes a predisposition to develop multiple schwannoma. It is diagnosed when an individual does not meet criteria for NF2-related schwannomatosis, SMARCB1-related schwannomatosis, or LTZR1-related schwannomatosis and both of the following molecular features exist: a loss of heterozygosity (LOH) of the same chromosome 22q markers in two anatomically distinct tumors or hybrid nerve sheath tumors and a different NF2 pathogenic variant in each tumor which cannot be detected in unaffected tissue.

label: TP63-related ectodermal dysplasia spectrum with limb and orofacial malformations
definition: Any developmental defect during embryogenesis in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the TP63 gene. This disease is characterized by variable ectodermal dysplasia, limb defects, and orofacial clefting.

label: KCND2-related neurodevelopmental disorder with or without seizures
definition: A neurodevelopmental disorder caused by variation in the KCND2 gene. This disorder is characterized by early-onset global developmental delay with impaired motor, speech and cognitive development. Patients often present muscle hypotonia, and less frequently, developmental epileptic encephalopathy, visual impairment and physical dysmorphisms.

label: PRPF19-related neurodevelopmental disorder
definition: Any neurodevelopmental disorder in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the PRPF19 gene. This disorder is characterised by developmental, motor and speech delay, and facial dysmorphisms. Most patients present mild to moderate intellectual disability, autism spectrum disorder or autistic features, and hypotonia. Other phenotypes observed less frequently include seizures, and visual and cardiac abnormalities.

label: CTR9-related neurodevelopmental disorder
definition: Any neurodevelopmental disorder in which the cause of the disease is a variation in the CTR9 gene. This disorder is characterised by varying degrees of intellectual disability, neurodevelopmental delay, hypotonia, fatigability, behavioral abnormalities including autism spectrum disorder, anxiety and aggressive behavior, cardiac anomalies, and mild facial dysmorphism.

label: hemihydranencephaly
definition: A rare congenital brain disorder characterized by complete or almost near-complete unilateral absence of the cortical cortex, which is filled by a sac of cerebrospinal fluid. The presumed cause is a prenatal vascular disruption with occlusion of the carotid artery territories ipsilateral to the damaged brain.

label: CAMK2D-related neurodevelopmental disorder and dilated cardiomyopathy
definition: A neurodevelopmental disorder caused by variation in the CAMK2D gene. This disorder is characterised by intellectual disability, speech and motor delay, behavioural problems and dilated cardiomyopathy. Patients often present brain structural anomalies and hypotonia, and less frequently, seizures.

label: PPFIA3-related neurodevelopmental disorder
definition: A neurodevelopmental disorder caused by variation in the PPFIA3 gene. This disorder is characterised by developmental delay and intellectual disability. Most patients present variable additional features, including dysmorphisms, microcephaly or macrocephaly, hypotonia, autism spectrum disorder or autistic features, abnormal electroencephalogram, and epilepsy.

label: linkeropathy
definition: Group of rare heritable connective tissue disorders, characterized by a variable degree of short stature, skeletal dysplasia, joint laxity, cutaneous anomalies, dysmorphism, heart malformation, and developmental delay. The LK genes encode for enzymes that add glycosaminoglycan chains onto proteoglycans via a common tetrasaccharide linker region.

label: NDUFB11-related disorders
definition: A group of rare genetic conditions caused by variants in the NDUFB11 gene. Presentation is heterogenous including neurologic, cardiac, ocular, and dermatological abnormalities.
